sentences.sContent: Rivers and lakes provide us with water transport and irrigation.
sentences.sContent_eng: Rivers and lakes provide us with water transport and irrigation.
sentences.sCn: 江河湖泽给我们以舟楫和灌溉之利。

sentences.sContent: In the United States, by contrast, 41% goes for agriculture, almost all of it for irrigation.
sentences.sContent_eng: In the United States, by contrast, 41% goes for agriculture, almost all of it for irrigation.
sentences.sCn: 与之相比，美国全年41%的水投向了农业，并几乎全都用在了灌溉上。

sentences.sContent: ...Most of these operations draw irrigation water from local rivers or lakes...
...untreated wastewater is the only viable irrigation source to keep farmmers in business...
...such as well-organized economies and transportation and irrigation systems...
...Better irrigation can dramatically improve crop yield and about 40% of the world's food supply is currently derived from irrigated land...
...water used in irrigation is often sourced unsustainably...

remMethod.val: ir(进入) ＋ rig(水) ＋ ation → 把水引进 → 灌溉
